summary: not skimpy. just adjusted. Female shoulders were too wide. sort of gave slightly more shape to a rather square armour. Check out version 3 for the restored female mesh Bethesda left out.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6]SEE MIRRORS TAB FOR DOWNLOAD LINK[/size]

[size=4]
[b]Version 3[/b]
Final version, I imagine.
[u]http://www.nbnakama.com/gamemods/skyrim/adjusted-female-dwarven-armour/v3/[/u]

[s][b]Version 2 aka Proper Version [/b]
Atempts to restores the female dwemer model that Bethesda scrapped.
[u]http://www.nbnakama.com/gamemods/skyrim/adjusted-female-dwarven-armour/v2/[/u][/s]

[b]Adjusted Version[/b]
narrowed shoulders, thinner waist and more hip.
[u]http://www.nbnakama.com/gamemods/skyrim/adjusted-female-dwarven-armour/v1/[/u]
[/size]

[size=\'3\'][color=\'red\'][b]An important announcement. I will no longer post my files on the nexus websites but rather on my own website (link above). If you would like to receive updates when I make new mods and the like, I have a facebook page and twitter you can subscribe to. Links are on my website.[/b][/color][/size]

[size=6]Adjusted Female Dwarven Armour[/size]

This mod was made because it was asked for nicely. Which shows that being polite in your requests and not asking for the moon goes a long way.

rockmanjunior asked me for a dwarven armour with less large shoulders. I took a quick look out of curiosity and it does turn out that that the female versions look pretty much the same as the male versions. In fact, the females look like burly quarterbacks in the dwarven armour.

I did a quick adjusts the width of the shoulders a bit and also the waistline.

The weight slider works on this one so it is safe for all.

This is not a skimpy version as the screenshots show.

[size=4]Installation[/size]

Extract to skyrim data folder to install.
author: Ketwaroo D Yaasir
